result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thony Renelique

records.addlTxt: Letter received from J.H.
Attachment to Atty Steile's letter filed 10/27/22
Letter received from Atty Steinle
disposition form - PSI ordered

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thony Renelique in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Thony Renelique. Family of victim present.  Interpreter present by video/phone and sworn. Counsel indicates he has reviewed all court documentation with defendant, an interpreter and def's family member.  Case is resolved w/PSI being recommended.  State moves to dismiss and read-in 22TR254; Court so orders. State makes the following recommendation:  Withheld sentence, 5 yrs probation, $268 court costs, $250 DNA surcharge, DNA, counseling per agent, no operation of a commercial vehicle, restitution of $15,624.79 + surcharge, extradition costs of $550.  State will recommend no more than 8 mos condition time w/huber - def will be free to argue.  Def enters no contest plea.  Court finds def guilty and orders PSI be prepared.  Court keeps bond as previously set and admonishes def re terms of bond.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thony Renelique in court.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Thony Renelique. Victim's family memers present.  Interpreter present by video and sworn.  Offer has been received - counsel is hopeful case will resolve w/no contest plea being entered, PSI being recommended and def being free to argue re sentence.  Due to language difference and def's understanding of the legal system, counsel will be setting up a phone call w/def and his family member to discuss the offer; 30-day adj requested.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on June 21, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thony Renelique appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Michael J Steinle appeared by zoom video for Thony Renelique. Clerk: EZ.  Victims wife and sister also appear.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant states Creole and French is defendant's first language.  Atty. Steinle states for purposes of this hearing the defendant does understand English and is not in need of an interpreter for today's hearing according to defendant's wife and employer he understands English more than speaks.  State requests $15,000.00 cash bond.  Atty. Steinle agrees with cash bond and makes additional statements and requests $5,000-7,000.00 cash bond.  Court orders $15,000.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for February 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
